channel.title: Stats on From System to System
channel.description: Recent content in Stats on From System to System

item.title: When principal component is not unique
item.description: This quarter, I’m TAing my adviser’s class on computational biology. Though I have taken this class a year ago and got an A, TAing really deepened my understanding of the course material, much of which I have long been using routinely without thinking, such as principal component analysis (PCA). On the midterm, there was a problem asking students to give an example of 8 points in \(\mathbb{R}^2\) that do not have a unique 1 dimensional principal component projection.
